Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech, which cannot be balanced with government control.
Governments have historically spread misinformation, so they should not be exempt from scrutiny.
The definition of misinformation/disinformation is vague and open to interpretation, which is concerning.
ACMA would have unchecked powers, which could lead to censorship of factual information.
Censoring information is harmful as it prevents societal and scientific advancement.
Healthy debate and expression are constitutional rights and should not be restricted.
Existing measures like the DIGI code are sufficient, making the legislation unnecessary.
The bill gives ACMA too much power and could lead to misinterpretation and censorship of information.
Notable Quotes: It is impossible to ‘balance the freedom of speech’.
ACMA will have unchecked powers to create enforceable rules without the ability to be questioned.
This is the type of legislation that would be passed by a tyrannical government not a democracy that values the freedom of speech.
